title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Rockets led by Kevin Durant's 26 points.
Boston played their third game in four days, including a road-home back-to-back, contributing to their defeat.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points on 6-for-7 shooting, showing potential on both ends of the floor.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate veteran RB D'Ernest Johnson to the roster with Rhamondre Stevenson out due to a toe injury.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, joins TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings in the Patriots' backfield.
D'Ernest Johnson offers versatility as he has experience returning kicks, potentially aiding the Patriots' special teams.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' defense improves with new McAvoy-Zadorov pairing, allowing only one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 minutes together.
McAvoy-Zadorov duo holds Carolina Hurricanes to one high-danger chance in 17:28 of 5-on-5 play in Boston's 2-1 win.
Hampus Lindholm's return boosts Bruins' defense; team achieves 5-1-0 record with him in the lineup this season.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman delivered a strong performance, stopping 27 of 28 shots in a 2-1 win over the Hurricanes.
Joonas Korpisalo started two consecutive games for the Bruins, posting a .933 save percentage in wins over the Islanders and Sabres.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Swayman's response after a difficult game against Ottawa, highlighting competition among goalies.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with flexibility under luxury tax, aiming to upgrade key positions like starting rotation, first and second base.
Star third baseman Alex Bregman may opt out of his contract; Dustin May, Rob Refsnyder, and others are set to become free agents.
Qualifying offer for 2026 stands at $22.025 million, likely candidate being Lucas Giolito; major signings could push team into luxury tax.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this regular season with CBS's No. 4 broadcast crew.
McCourty is surprised by the Patriots' 6-2 record, attributing success to quarterback Drake Maye's leap in performance.
Drake Maye has sparked attention for MVP discussions, highlighted by impressive performances in wins against Dolphins and Titans.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly targeting Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before Tuesday's NFL trade deadline.
Phillips, 26, has recorded three sacks this season, returning strong after an Achilles injury in 2023.
Miami demands at least a third-round pick for Phillips, with the 49ers and Eagles also expressing interest.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei, a Bruins defenseman, has been scratched for three consecutive games, missing Saturday's game against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm stated Lohrei should be upset about being benched, emphasizing it's part of his learning process.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Nikita Zadorov's effective pairing with Charlie McAvoy have influenced Boston's defensive lineup decisions.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons hold a 3-4 record entering their game against the Patriots, aiming for a playoff push.
Bijan Robinson leads the NFL with 137.4 scrimmage yards per game, posing dual-threat challenges for the Patriots.
The Falcons rank second in the NFL for yards allowed per game, with a strong secondary headlined by A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, helping the Dodgers take a 3-0 lead over the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez made a game-ending defensive play, throwing out a Blue Jays runner to seal the Dodgers' 3-1 victory.
The win in Game 6 forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series between the Dodgers and Blue Jays.
